metadata.synopsis: Ferg, a Sharran Informer is Shadowheart's contact for her to reach out to when completing her mission. He impresses they have been waiting for her return. If on the Shar Path he will reveal that there is a chance for Shadowheart to take over. If not, he will be deeply skeptical of Shadowheart.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to Sharess's Caress2. Bring Shadowheart3. Talk to Ferg Drogher

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.context: NodeContext: Overall Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and is on a mission to Baldur's Gate to save her captive parents.

7.speaker: Shadowheart
7.text: I'm not here to answer to you, or anyone else. I'm here for my parents.
7.context: NodeContext: Overall Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar and is on a mission to Baldur's Gate to save her captive parents.

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.context: NodeContext: Overall arc: Shadowheart has been blessed by her goddess Shar after sacrificing Nightsong. She is now on a mission to seize control of Shar's church and followers in Baldur's Gate

15.speaker: Shadowheart
15.context: NodeContext: Overall arc: Shadowheart has been blessed by her goddess Shar after sacrificing Nightsong. She is now on a mission to seize control of Shar's church and followers in Baldur's Gate

54.speaker: Ferg Drogher
54.text: I just lost a wager, thanks to you.

39.speaker: Ferg Drogher
39.text: Someone who bet that you'd never be foolish enough to actually show your face in this city again. But here you are, and the gold in my purse is soon to take flight.

48.speaker: Ferg Drogher
48.text: I can't help but feel the strangest twinge of disgust as I look upon you. Is it true? Has our Lady forsaken you?

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *A follower of Shar. An agent of the Mother Superior. Sent to keep watch for you.*

63.speaker: Shadowheart
63.text: I'm not here to answer to you, or anyone else. I'm here for my parents.

62.speaker: Ferg Drogher
62.text: So, the rot of heresy has gripped you. So be it.

66.speaker: Ferg Drogher
66.text: Now I must report your reappearance. If you are intent on bringing matters to a head, then seek out the House of Grief, in the Lower City.
66.context: NodeContext: Unpleasant smile, relishing in twisting the knife. (In reality 'Rennald' is now Nightshade, a transgender friend of Shadowheart's who she can't remember).

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: Tell me one thing... Is there someone called Rennald there? A tiefling with short horns and purple hair.
33.context: NodeContext: Unpleasant smile, relishing in twisting the knife. (In reality 'Rennald' is now Nightshade, a transgender friend of Shadowheart's who she can't remember).

8.speaker: Ferg Drogher
8.text: Rennald... Now there is a name I haven't heard in a while. He is no more. I'll leave the rest for you to find out, heretic.
8.context: NodeContext: Unpleasant smile, relishing in twisting the knife. (In reality 'Rennald' is now Nightshade, a transgender friend of Shadowheart's who she can't remember).

32.speaker: Ferg Drogher
32.text: Though if I was you, I'd be very tempted to just forget it all and disappear. You have some form at doing so, after all.

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Shar forsakes everyone in the end. Her embrace is a lie.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: I have... strayed, it is true. But I have come to make amends, and face judgement.

10.speaker: Ferg Drogher
10.text: No true child of Lady Shar would be that poor a liar. The rot of heresy truly has taken hold in you.

59.speaker: Ferg Drogher
59.text: No true child of Lady Shar would be that poor a liar. The rot of heresy truly has taken hold in you.

64.text: Bold of you - brave, even. Though do not assume passing admiration will translate to mercy when you kneel before the Mother Superior.

31.speaker: Ferg Drogher
31.text: Bold of you - brave, even. Though do not assume passing admiration will translate to mercy when you kneel before the Mother Superior.

18.speaker: Shadowheart
18.text: If that was supposed to be a pick-up line, I think it needs more work.

65.speaker: Ferg Drogher
65.text: Don't flatter yourself - you're not my type. Even though we have more in common than you remember.

1.speaker: Ferg Drogher
1.text: Insolent, even now. I heard you were like that.

36.speaker: Ferg Drogher
36.text: Many of us were convinced you'd never actually show your face in this city again. But here you are, and the gold in my purse is soon to take flight.

69.speaker: Ferg Drogher
69.text: What a sight for sore eyes. I believe there's somewhere you're supposed to be, no? Long overdue, in fact.

70.speaker: Ferg Drogher
70.text: No, but I know you. I was told to keep watch for you and point you towards home, should you ever appear.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: Maybe so. Where is it you think I'm expected?

47.speaker: Ferg Drogher
47.text: Why, home, of course. The only one you have ever known. I was told to keep watch for you and point you towards home, should you ever appear.

30.speaker: Shadowheart
30.text: No. Perhaps you've mistaken me for somebody else?

20.speaker: Ferg Drogher
20.text: There is no mistake, Shadowheart. I was told to keep watch for you and point you towards home, should you ever appear.

2.speaker: Ferg Drogher
2.text: And lo, you have appeared. It is time for you to return to the fold.

4.speaker: Ferg Drogher
4.text: She did. And I feel her patience is running thin. I hope you have good news for her. First, you need to continue onwards into the Lower City.

13.speaker: Ferg Drogher
13.text: Then seek out a place called the House of Grief. It may not be quite what you expect, but I assure you it's the right spot. Go there, and make yourself known. You will be given the welcome you deserve.

34.speaker: Ferg Drogher
34.text: Oh no, I must remain here. In truth, I'm glad to keep my distance for now... There's been some tension in the ranks. It seems a great deal is riding on the outcome of your mission.

37.speaker: Ferg Drogher
37.text: Besides, I have business to attend to, wares to sell. Our great endeavour cannot run on faith alone - we need funds. Have a look, if you wish.

26.speaker: Shadowheart
26.text: What can I expect once I'm admitted?

41.speaker: Ferg Drogher
41.text: And spoil the surprise? I dare not. Though I will admit there's been some tension in the ranks. It seems a great deal is riding on the outcome of your mission.

29.speaker: Ferg Drogher
29.text: I don't envy you, I'll admit... There's been some tension in the ranks. It seems a great deal is riding on the outcome of your mission.

5.speaker: Ferg Drogher
5.text: I'll be remaining here - I have business to attend to, wares to sell. Our great endeavour cannot run on faith alone - we need funds. Have a look, if you wish.

51.speaker: Ferg Drogher
51.text: Otherwise, I think we're done. Try not to dawdle too much in the city - Mother's waiting.

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: Tell me... is there someone called Rennald there? A tiefling with short horns and purple hair.

53.speaker: Ferg Drogher
53.text: Rennald... Now there's a name I haven't heard in some time. But not for me to spoil what Lady Shar would keep hidden from you. Best if you looked for yourself.

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: You're talking about the cloister? Point the way.

71.speaker: Ferg Drogher
71.text: So close to home and yet you need a guiding hand. Amazing how malleable - or fragile - the mind can be. First, you need to continue onwards into the Lower City.

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: I'm not here to submit. I'm here to cleanse Lady Shar's ranks. She decreed it.

12.speaker: Ferg Drogher
12.text: Hmm. Some thought you might have been humbled by your mission - learned a little deference. Clearly not. First, you must continue into the Lower City.
